channel.title: NPR Topics: National
channel.description: NPR coverage of national news, U.S. politics, elections, business, arts, culture, health and science, and technology. Subscribe to the NPR Nation RSS feed.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Federal officers kill a man in Minneapolis, and DHS offers few details
item.description: Federal immigration officers shot and killed a U.S. citizen on Saturday in Minneapolis, drawing hundreds of protesters in a city already shaken by another fatal shooting earlier this month. DHS says the man was armed and "violently resisted" arrest but refused to answer further questions.
item.content:encoded: Federal immigration officers shot and killed a U.S. citizen on Saturday in Minneapolis, drawing hundreds of protesters in a city already shaken by another fatal shooting earlier this month. DHS says the man was armed and "violently resisted" arrest but refused to answer further questions.
item.dc:creator: Eric Westervelt

item.title: Minneapolis emergency management director invokes Yemen and Ukraine to describe events at home
item.description: Reaction from Minneapolis Emergency Management Director Rachel Sayre to Saturday's shooting and the subsequent street confrontations.
item.content:encoded: Reaction from Minneapolis Emergency Management Director Rachel Sayre to Saturday's shooting and the subsequent street confrontations.
item.dc:creator: Avery Keatley

item.title: Man shot dead by federal immigration officers in Minneapolis
item.description: The incident, which was caught on video, marks the second deadly shooting by federal officers in Minneapolis in less than a month.
item.content:encoded:
The incident, which was caught on video, marks the second deadly shooting by federal officers in Minneapolis in less than a month.

(Image credit: Erin Trieb for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Cheryl W. Thompson

item.title: A man is fatally shot by federal agents in Minneapolis
item.description: Federal agents have shot and killed another person in Minneapolis, this time a 51-year-old man.
item.content:encoded: Federal agents have shot and killed another person in Minneapolis, this time a 51-year-old man.
item.dc:creator: Eric Westervelt

item.title: Trump threatens Canada with 100% tariffs over its new trade deal with China
item.description: The announcement is a reversal for Trump, who initially initially praised the agreement with China as something Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney "should be doing."
item.content:encoded:
The announcement is a reversal for Trump, who initially initially praised the agreement with China as something Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney "should be doing."

(Image credit: Jacques Boissinot)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: How residents are coping as they brace for a major winter storm
item.description: The fierce winter storm is predicted to bring a foot of snow, or more, and catastrophic ice and freezing rain to a huge swath of the eastern U.S. We check in on Tulsa, Okla. and how residents there are doing.
item.content:encoded: The fierce winter storm is predicted to bring a foot of snow, or more, and catastrophic ice and freezing rain to a huge swath of the eastern U.S. We check in on Tulsa, Okla. and how residents there are doing.
item.dc:creator: Scott Simon

item.title: ICE says it has arrested more than 100 people in Maine this week
item.description: Immigration and Customs Enforcement says it has arrested more than 100 people so far in Maine as part of an ongoing, large-scale operation that began this week.
item.content:encoded: Immigration and Customs Enforcement says it has arrested more than 100 people so far in Maine as part of an ongoing, large-scale operation that began this week.
item.dc:creator: Ari Snider

item.title: EEOC withdraws previous harassment guidance
item.description: The EEOC voted to rescind its 2024 harassment guidance, which explained what constitutes unlawful harassment. The vote came amid a fight over a section of the guidance focused on gender identity.
item.content:encoded: The EEOC voted to rescind its 2024 harassment guidance, which explained what constitutes unlawful harassment. The vote came amid a fight over a section of the guidance focused on gender identity.
item.dc:creator: Andrea Hsu

item.title: As the winter storm rages, here's what to know in your state
item.description: Reporters across the NPR Network are covering the impact of the storm and how officials are responding. We've also got tips for staying safe once bad weather hits.
item.content:encoded:
Reporters across the NPR Network are covering the impact of the storm and how officials are responding. We've also got tips for staying safe once bad weather hits.

(Image credit: George Walker IV)
item.dc:creator: Anusha Mathur

item.title: A deadly standoff in 1992 changed federal use-of-force rules. Here's why it matters
item.description: An encounter with white separatists decades ago led to new deadly force policies for some federal law enforcement. Minneapolis is raising questions about whether it's again time to revisit the issue.
item.content:encoded:
An encounter with white separatists decades ago led to new deadly force policies for some federal law enforcement. Minneapolis is raising questions about whether it's again time to revisit the issue.

(Image credit: Angelina Katsanis)
item.dc:creator: Odette Yousef
